data.event: The post office was established September 22, 1894.
When the town was platted in 1876, the citizens wished to choose a name, which would suggest the chief industry in the area, stone quarrying.

event.title: 1857 John and Margaret Prey, adult sons, John W., Thomas, and William, and teenage children, David and Rebecca, came

data.event: In 1857 John and Margaret Prey, adult sons, John W., Thomas, and William, and teenage children, David and Rebecca, came from Wisconsin to preempt land near the proposed town called "Olathe."

event.title: the future of the area, which was designated

data.event: There were high hopes for the future of the area, which was designated as "Clay County."
